---

## ✅ KENAPA STRUKTUR INI AMAN UNTUK 5 DEV

### 1️⃣ **Feature-based isolation (paling penting)**
Setiap developer bisa pegang **1–2 feature** tanpa saling sentuh.

```text
Dev 1 → features/auth
Dev 2 → features/home
Dev 3 → features/profile
Dev 4 → features/checkout
Dev 5 → core / shared
```

➡ Konflik git **hampir nol**  
➡ Tidak rebutan file

---

### 2️⃣ `core/` & `shared/` terkunci (controlled changes)
Folder ini **jarang berubah**, hanya:
- Tech lead / reviewer
- Perubahan lewat PR

```text
core/   → infra, network, theme
shared/ → reusable widget/state
```

➡ Developer lain **tidak bebas ubah** → aman

---

### 3️⃣ Riverpod + Bloc = tidak tabrakan
| Kebutuhan | Lokasi |
|--------|------|
| Dependency, config | `core/di`, `app_provider.dart` |
| Business logic | `features/*/presentation/bloc` |
| UI | `features/*/presentation/pages` |

➡ Tidak ada **god file**  
➡ Tidak ada **global mutable state**

---

### 4️⃣ Multi-brand tidak bikin konflik
Brand **dipisah total**:

```text
brands/brand_a/
brands/brand_b/
```

➡ Dev A kerjakan Brand A  
➡ Dev B kerjakan Brand B  
➡ Asset & theme tidak bentrok

---

### 5️⃣ Routing & App entry satu pintu
```text
app/
├── app_router.dart
├── app.dart
```

➡ Semua routing lewat **satu file**
➡ Mudah review & resolve conflict

---

## ⚠️ RISIKO (JIKA TANPA ATURAN)

❌ Semua dev bebas edit `core/`  
❌ Tidak ada ownership feature  
❌ Logic masuk ke UI  
❌ Riverpod dipakai sembarangan sebagai state kompleks

➡ Ini yang bikin project hancur walau strukturnya bagus

---

## 🧱 ATURAN WAJIB (SANGAT DISARANKAN)

### 🔐 1️⃣ Ownership Folder
```text
features/auth     → Owner: Dev A
features/profile  → Owner: Dev B
core/             → Tech Lead only
```

---

### 📦 2️⃣ Dependency Rule
❌ Feature A import Feature B  
✅ Lewat `shared/` atau `domain`

```dart
// ❌ DILARANG
import '../../profile/profile_page.dart';

// ✅ BENAR
import '../../../shared/widgets/app_button.dart';
```

---

### 🔄 3️⃣ State Management Rule
| Kondisi | Pakai |
|------|------|
| Flow kompleks | Bloc |
| Simple UI state | Riverpod |
| Global config | Riverpod |

---

### 🧪 4️⃣ Testing Boundary
```text
features/auth/test/
features/profile/test/
```

➡ Dev test **fiturnya sendiri**

---

### 🌳 5️⃣ Git Workflow
**Minimum wajib:**
- `main`
- `develop`
- `feature/<feature-name>`

```text
feature/auth-login
feature/profile-edit
```

➡ PR → Review → Merge

Buat lagi strukturnya dengan tambahan bottom navigation, drawer, jadi tiap bottom nav home clicked tampilannya sesuai brand yg dipilih dari drawer
Berarti riverpod di setting providerscope di main ? Dan bloc hanya di tiap page ?

Sekarang kita bahas **kenapa ini best practice**, **kapan boleh menyimpang**, dan **contoh konkret yang benar & salah**.

## ✅ 1️⃣ Riverpod di `main()` (GLOBAL)

### 📍 `main.dart`
```dart
void main() {
  runApp(
    const ProviderScope(
      child: App(),
    ),
  );
}
```

### 🎯 Kenapa?
Riverpod dipakai untuk:
- Global state (brand aktif, bottom nav index)
- Dependency Injection (Dio, Repository)
- App config (theme, locale, auth session)

📌 **State ini harus hidup selama app hidup**

---

### ✅ Contoh Provider GLOBAL
```dart
// brand
final brandProvider = StateProvider<BrandConfig>((ref) => BrandAConfig());

// navigation
final bottomNavIndexProvider = StateProvider<int>((ref) => 0);

// dependency
final dioProvider = Provider<Dio>((ref) => Dio());
```

➡ Aman dideklarasikan **sekali**  
➡ Bisa dipakai di mana saja

---

## ❌ SALAH (anti-pattern)
```dart
BlocProvider(
  child: ProviderScope( // ❌ jangan
    child: HomePage(),
  ),
);
```

❌ ProviderScope di tengah widget tree  
❌ State ke-reset tanpa sadar  

---

## ✅ 2️⃣ Bloc hanya di Page / Feature

### 📍 Contoh BENAR
```dart
class LoginPage extends ConsumerWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context, WidgetRef ref) {
    return BlocProvider(
      create: (_) => AuthBloc(
        ref.read(loginUseCaseProvider),
      ),
      child: const LoginView(),
    );
  }
}
```

🎯 **Kenapa Bloc di sini?**
- Lifecycle mengikuti page
- Auto dispose saat page pop
- State tidak bocor ke page lain

---

## ❌ SALAH (anti-pattern)
```dart
void main() {
  runApp(
    MultiBlocProvider( // ❌ jangan global
      providers: [
        BlocProvider(create: (_) => AuthBloc()),
        BlocProvider(create: (_) => HomeBloc()),
      ],
      child: ProviderScope(child: App()),
    ),
  );
}
```

❌ Semua bloc hidup selamanya  
❌ Boros memory  
❌ Sulit debugging  

---

## 🧠 RULE OF THUMB (WAJIB DIINGAT)

### 🟢 Riverpod
| Gunakan untuk | Lokasi |
|-------------|--------|
| Global state | main / app |
| Dependency | core/di |
| Config | app_provider |

### 🔵 Bloc
| Gunakan untuk | Lokasi |
|-------------|--------|
| Business logic | Page / Feature |
| Flow kompleks | presentation/bloc |
| API-driven state | feature-level |

---

## 🧩 3️⃣ Hybrid: Riverpod inject ke Bloc (BEST PRACTICE)

```dart
BlocProvider(
  create: (_) => HomeBloc(
    ref.read(homeRepositoryProvider),
    ref.read(brandProvider),
  ),
  child: const HomeView(),
);
```

✔ Riverpod → injector  
✔ Bloc → executor  

---

## 🏗️ 4️⃣ Bagaimana dengan BottomNav?

### BottomNav index → Riverpod
```dart
final bottomNavIndexProvider = StateProvider<int>((ref) => 0);
```

### Tiap tab → Page + Bloc sendiri
```text
HomeTab
 ├── HomeBloc
CartTab
 ├── CartBloc
ProfileTab
 ├── ProfileBloc
```

➡ Tidak saling ganggu

---

## ⚠️ KAPAN BOLEH PAKAI Bloc GLOBAL?
**Jarang, tapi boleh jika:**
- Connectivity
- Auth session stream
- App lifecycle

```dart
BlocProvider(
  create: (_) => ConnectivityBloc(),
  child: App(),
);
```

📌 Biasanya tetap diletakkan **di AppShell**, bukan `main`

---

## 🧠 KESIMPULAN FINAL

✔ **ProviderScope di main → WAJIB**  
✔ **Riverpod = global + DI**  
✔ **Bloc = per page / feature**  
✔ **Jangan global Bloc kecuali sangat perlu**  

Ini adalah **pola paling stabil** untuk:
- Multi brand
- Bottom nav
- 5–10 developer
- Long-term maintenance

# 🎯 MASALAH UMUM (KENAPA ROUTER SERING KONFLIK)

❌ Semua dev edit `app_router.dart`  
❌ Route didefinisikan inline  
❌ Path ditulis string literal  
❌ Feature A & B rebutan route

➡ Akhirnya:
- Merge conflict
- Bug redirect
- Salah path
- Chaos 😅

# ✅ SOLUSI UTAMA (TERBUKTI AMAN)

## 🧱 PRINSIP EMAS
> **App router hanya COMPOSE, bukan DEFINE**

Artinya:
- `app_router.dart` **tidak berisi detail route feature**
- Tiap feature **punya file route sendiri**
- Router utama **hanya menggabungkan**

---

# 🏗️ STRUKTUR ANTI-KONFLIK (REKOMENDASI)

```text
lib/
│
├── app/
│   └── app_router.dart        # ⬅ hanya gabung route
│
├── navigation/
│   ├── routes.dart            # ⬅ konstanta path
│   └── shell_route.dart       # ⬅ BottomNav shell
│
├── features/
│   ├── auth/
│   │   └── auth_routes.dart
│   │
│   ├── home/
│   │   └── home_routes.dart
│   │
│   ├── cart/
│   │   └── cart_routes.dart
│   │
│   ├── profile/
│   │   └── profile_routes.dart
│   │
│   └── settings/
│       └── settings_routes.dart
```

➡ **1 feature = 1 file route**  
➡ Dev **tidak sentuh router utama**

---

# 🧭 ROUTE CONSTANT (WAJIB)

## `navigation/routes.dart`
```dart
abstract class Routes {
  static const login = '/login';
  static const home = '/';
  static const cart = '/cart';
  static const profile = '/profile';
  static const settings = '/settings';
}
```

❌ DILARANG:
```dart
context.go('/cart'); // ❌
```

✅ WAJIB:
```dart
context.go(Routes.cart);
```

## `features/cart/cart_routes.dart`

```dart
class CartRoutes {
  static List<RouteBase> routes() => [
        GoRoute(
          path: Routes.cart,
          builder: (_, __) => const CartPage(),
        ),

}
```

# 🧱 SHELL ROUTE TERPUSAT

## `navigation/shell_route.dart`
```dart
class AppShellRoute {
  static ShellRoute build(List<RouteBase> children) {
    return ShellRoute(
      builder: (context, state, child) {
        return AppShell(child: child);
      },
      routes: children,
    );
  }
}
```

➡ Tidak disentuh dev feature

# 🚦 ROUTER UTAMA (COMPOSITION ONLY)

## `app/app_router.dart`
```dart
final routerProvider = Provider<GoRouter>((ref) {
  final auth = ref.watch(authProvider);

  return GoRouter(
    redirect: (context, state) {
      final isLoggedIn =
          auth.status == AuthStatus.authenticated;

      if (!isLoggedIn && state.matchedLocation != Routes.login) {
        return Routes.login;
      }

      if (isLoggedIn && state.matchedLocation == Routes.login) {
        return Routes.home;
      }

      return null;
    },
    routes: [
      AppShellRoute.build([
        ...HomeRoutes.routes(),
        ...CartRoutes.routes(),
        ...ProfileRoutes.routes(),
      ]),
      ...AuthRoutes.routes(),
    ],
  );
});
```

📌 **Yang boleh diubah di sini hanya:**
- Auth guard
- Shell composition

```dart
void main() {
```

```dart
    'APP_ENV',
    defaultValue: 'dev',
  );

  final config =
      env == 'prod' ? ProdEnvConfig() : DevEnvConfig();

  runApp(
    ProviderScope(
      overrides: [
        envConfigProvider.overrideWithValue(config),
      ],
      child: const App(),
    ),
  );
}
```

# 4️⃣ ENV LOADER (SATU PINTU)

## `core/config/env_loader.dart`
```dart
import 'package:flutter_dotenv/flutter_dotenv.dart';

class EnvLoader {
  static Future<void> load(String flavor) async {
    switch (flavor) {
      case 'prod':
        await dotenv.load(fileName: '.env.prod');
        break;
      case 'dev':
      default:
        await dotenv.load(fileName: '.env.dev');
        break;
    }
  }
}
```

📌 **JANGAN load dotenv di banyak tempat**

```dart
class EnvConfig {
  static String get baseUrl => dotenv.env['BASE_URL']!;
  static bool get enableLogging =>
      dotenv.env['ENABLE_LOGGING'] == 'true';
  static String get apiKey => dotenv.env['API_KEY']!;
}
```

Tinggal bilang mau lanjut ke mana 👍

welcome to the sushi tei group

apakah correct penulisannya ?

Kalimat **“welcome to the sushi tei group”** **sudah bisa dipahami**, tapi **penulisannya belum sepenuhnya tepat** jika ingin terlihat rapi dan profesional.

Beberapa opsi yang **lebih benar dan umum digunakan**:

1. **“Welcome to the Sushi Tei Group”** ✅  
   → Huruf kapital dipakai untuk nama brand/perusahaan.

2. Jika ingin lebih formal:
   - **“Welcome to Sushi Tei Group”** ✅  
   - **“Welcome to the Sushi Tei Group!”** ✅ (lebih ramah)

3. Jika konteksnya internal / santai:
   - **“Welcome to Sushi Tei Group 😊”**

❌ Yang kurang tepat:
- **“welcome to the sushi tei group”**  
  → Semua huruf kecil, tidak sesuai kaidah penulisan nama proper (proper noun).

Kalau mau, beri tahu konteksnya (email resmi, WhatsApp, poster, onboarding karyawan), nanti saya bisa bantu pilih kalimat yang paling pas.
untuk welcome screen aplikasi

Untuk **welcome screen aplikasi**, sebaiknya singkat, jelas, dan terlihat profesional.

Rekomendasi paling tepat:

✅ **“Welcome to Sushi Tei Group”**

Alternatif lain (tergantung tone aplikasi):

- Lebih ramah:
  - **“Welcome to Sushi Tei Group!”**
- Lebih modern & minimal:
  - **“Welcome to Sushi Tei”** (jika aplikasinya hanya fokus ke brand utama)
- Bilingual (umum dipakai di Indonesia):
  - **“Welcome to Sushi Tei Group”**
  - **“Selamat Datang di Sushi Tei Group”**

❗Catatan penting:
- Gunakan **huruf kapital di awal kata** (Title Case)
- Hindari semua huruf kecil untuk welcome screen karena terlihat kurang profesional

Kalau mau, saya juga bisa bantu:
- Copy lengkap welcome screen (judul + subtext)
- Versi formal vs friendly
- Bahasa Inggris vs Indonesia

Tinggal bilang ya 👍
Select Brand in Sushi Tei Group: apakah kalimat dan grammarnya pas

Kalimat **“Select Brand in Sushi Tei Group”** bisa dipahami, tetapi **kurang alami** dan **tidak sepenuhnya tepat** dalam konteks bahasa Inggris formal maupun sebagai judul menu/pilihan.

Berikut evaluasinya:

### ❌ Masalah pada kalimat tersebut
- **Select Brand** terdengar seperti perintah langsung, tetapi kurang jelas objeknya.
- **In Sushi Tei Group** terasa seperti keterangan tambahan yang kurang mengalir.
- Jika ini adalah judul dropdown atau menu untuk memilih brand di dalam grup Sushi Tei, ada pilihan yang lebih natural.

### ✔️ Alternatif yang lebih tepat
Berikut beberapa opsi tergantung konteks:

#### **Jika untuk judul menu/dropdown pemilihan brand:**
- **Select a Brand in the Sushi Tei Group**
- **Choose a Brand under the Sushi Tei Group**
- **Brand Selection – Sushi Tei Group**
- **Sushi Tei Group Brand Selection**

#### **Jika untuk instruksi singkat (UI label):**
- **Select Brand**
- **Choose Brand**
  
*(Tanpa tambahan “in Sushi Tei Group” jika konteksnya sudah jelas dari halaman atau aplikasi.)*

### ✔️ Kesimpulan
Kalimat **“Select Brand in Sushi Tei Group”** *bisa* dimengerti tetapi **kurang natural**. Versi yang lebih benar secara grammar adalah:

➡️ **“Select a brand in the Sushi Tei Group.”**

Kalau kamu berikan konteks penggunaannya (judul halaman, menu dropdown, button, dsb.), aku bisa bantu memilih versi terbaik.
buatkan welcome text dan Brand Selection – Sushi Tei Group

Berikut contoh **welcome text** dan **judul Brand Selection – Sushi Tei Group** yang ringkas, natural, dan cocok untuk website atau aplikasi:

---

## ⭐ **Welcome Text**
**Welcome to the Sushi Tei Group Portal**  
Discover our family of brands and explore the unique culinary experiences we offer. Please choose a brand to begin.

Plural (jamak) dari *moment*.

how to in figma if have change 1 layout, all layout changed too?

To make **one layout change update all layouts automatically in Figma**, you should use **Components** and **Styles**.  
Here’s the clear & simple explanation:

---

# ✅ **How to Make One Layout Change Update Everywhere in Figma**

## **1. Convert your layout into a *Component***
1. Select the frame/layout you want to reuse.  
2. Press **⌥⌘K (Mac)** or **Ctrl + Alt + K (Windows)**  
   → This creates a **Main Component**.  
3. Duplicate or place instances of this component anywhere.

### 🔄 Now, when you edit the **Main Component**,  
**all Instances will update automatically.**

---

## **2. Use *Auto Layout* inside the component**
If your layout uses auto layout, changes like spacing, padding, or alignment will also cascade to all instances.

---

## **3. Use *Variants* if you need multiple layout states**
If you need different versions (mobile, desktop, hover, expanded, etc.)
1. Select the component  
2. Click **“Combine as Variants”**  
3. Switch variants inside instances without breaking connection.

---

## **4. Use *Styles* for consistent text and colors**
If you change a text style or color style:
- All elements linked to that style will update.

---

# 🎯 **Summary**
To make all layouts update when you change one:

### **✔️ Use Components → Main Component updates all instances**  
### **✔️ Use Auto Layout for flexible structure**  
### **✔️ Use Styles for shared text/colors**  
### **✔️ Use Variants for alternate states**

---

parts:
Oke — aku buat panduan **step-by-step** yang praktis dan langsung bisa kamu ikuti di Figma supaya satu perubahan bisa mempengaruhi semua layout tanpa harus `Ctrl/Cmd + D` berulang-ulang. Aku sertakan trik cepat untuk *existing duplicates* juga.

Aku jelaskan dua skenario: **(A)** semua layout ada di *satu file* dan **(B)** layouts tersebar di *beberapa file*. Ikuti sesuai kebutuhan.

---

# A — Satu file (paling sering terjadi)
### Tujuan: ubah 1 *Main Component*, semua *Instance* di semua page otomatis ikut berubah.

1. **Pilih satu frame/layout yang ingin jadi sumber (main).**  
   — Pastikan ini adalah versi *definitif* (nama, spacing, teks, style sudah benar).

2. **Buat jadi Component (Main).**  
   - Shortcut: **Mac** `⌥⌘K` / **Win** `Ctrl+Alt+K`  
   - Atau kanan-klik → **Create component**.  
   > Hasil: komponen utama muncul di canvas + di panel *Assets*.

3. **Taruh satu Instance dari komponen itu di tempat yang kamu mau.**  
   - Dari panel **Assets**, drag komponen ke canvas — itu adalah *instance*.  
   - Atau copy (⌘C / Ctrl+C) main component, paste (⌘V / Ctrl+V) → yang dipaste adalah **instance**.

4. **Ganti semua duplicat lama dengan Instances (cepat!).**  
   - Cara cepat: **Copy instance** (pilih instance → `⌘C`/`Ctrl+C`) → buka page lain → pilih duplicate frame lama lalu **paste** (`⌘V`/`Ctrl+V`).  
     - Jika kamu ingin posisi persis sama: copy instance, pergi ke page tujuan, tekan `⌘⇧V` / `Ctrl+Shift+V` (Paste in place) untuk menempel di koordinat yang sama.  
   - Ulangi untuk semua page / lokasi.  
   > Catatan: *Jangan* gunakan `Ctrl/Cmd+D` pada frames yang kamu copy dari halaman yang sama — paste instance di page lain tetap mempertahankan link ke main component.

5. **Edit hanya Main Component bila ingin perubahan global.**  
   - Double-click komponen utama (bukan instance) lalu ubah. Semua instance akan update otomatis.

6. **Periksa apakah ada Instance yang ‘detached’.**  
   - Jika instance tidak ikut berubah, kemungkinan itu *detached instance*. Klik instance → jika opsi “Detach instance” muncul (artinya masih instance). Jika ada menu “Reset instance”/“Reset overrides”, coba itu.  
   - Jika instance sudah *detached*, buat ulang instance dengan copy/paste dari Assets.

---

# B — Banyak file (file berbeda / tim)
### Tujuan: supaya perubahan komponen tersebar ke file lain

1. **Buat komponen di satu file ‘source’** (seperti langkah A).  
2. **Publish sebagai Team Library**  
   - Pilih menu: `Assets` → `Team Library` → **Publish**.  
   - Isi changelog singkat lalu Publish.

3. **Di file lain, aktifkan library**  
   - `Assets` → `Team Library` → toggle on nama library-mu.

4. **Ganti duplicate layouts di file lain dengan Instances dari library**  
   - Dari `Assets` (library aktif), drag komponen ke file tujuan atau copy instance dari file source dan paste ke file lain → **Instances** akan tersambung ke library.

5. **Saat edit di file source → Publish lagi**  
   - Setelah edit main component di file source, **Publish** update di Team Library supaya file lain menerima update (mereka akan diminta untuk *Update available* dan bisa apply).

---

# Shortcut & tips praktis
- **Create component:** Mac `⌥⌘K` / Win `Ctrl+Alt+K`  
- **Copy / Paste in place:** Mac `⌘⇧V` / Win `Ctrl+Shift+V`  
- **Drag from Assets** untuk menambah instance (lebih aman daripada recreate manual).  
- **Gunakan Auto Layout & Styles** (Text/Color/Effects) agar perubahan kecil konsisten di semua instance.  
- **Nama component & organize** di Assets (mis. `Buttons / Primary / Desktop`) supaya gampang find & replace.

---

# Troubleshooting singkat
- *Perubahan tidak muncul:* kemungkinan instance sudah **detached**. Solusi: ganti dengan instance baru dari Assets.  
- *Ingin mempertahankan teks/image berbeda per page:* Instances bisa menerima overrides (kamu bisa ubah teks/image di instance tanpa memutus link struktur). Tapi perubahan struktur (padding, layout utama) tetap dari Main Component.  
- *Banyak file & tim:* selalu gunakan **Publish Library** agar tim bisa sync perubahan.

---

if have change in component, how to edit that ? and what create component again ?

Here’s the **clear and simple explanation** so you fully understand **HOW to edit a component** in Figma and **WHEN you need to create a component again (or not).**

---

# ✅ 1. **If you have a change in a component, how do you edit it?**

### 👉 **You MUST edit the *Main Component*** — not the duplicate, not the instance.

### How to find the Main Component:
1. Select any **instance** on your canvas.
2. In the right sidebar, click:
   **“Go to main component”**
3. Figma will jump to the original (main) version.

### Then:
4. Edit the **Main Component** (resize, change text style, spacing, auto layout, colors).
5. **All instances everywhere update automatically.**

You do **NOT** need to rebuild the component again.

---

# ❌ 2. **Do you create a component again after editing?**
### **No.**  
You **never** create a new component again if one already exists.

Creating a new component = restarting.  
Editing the Main Component = updating all versions automatically.

---

# ✅ 3. **When do you need to create a component again?**
Only in these cases:

### **A. You don’t have a component yet.**  
You created frames manually, so there is no Main Component.

### **B. You accidentally “Detach Instance” earlier.**  
If your instance lost its connection, you need to replace it with a real component instance.

### **C. Your layout is completely new**  
A new UI element that didn’t exist before.

Otherwise — **never recreate the component**.

---

# 🧩 Quick Visual Explanation (text version)

**Main Component**  
⬇ updates automatically to all  

**Instances on pages**  
- They receive the update  
- They keep overrides (like text, images, icons)

---

# ⚡ Quick Step-by-Step Example
Let’s say you want to change the padding of a card layout:

1. Select any card instance on the page.  
2. Click **Go to Main Component**.  
3. Change padding from 16 → 20.  
4. Instantly, all cards in all pages update.

Done.

No need to:
- remake component  
- detach anything  
- copy/paste again  
- ctrl+D duplicates

---

# 🎯 Summary
| Task | What to do |
|------|------------|
| Change design | Edit **Main Component** |
| Want all pages updated | Edit **Main Component** |
| Already have component | **Do NOT create new component** |
| Lost connection | Replace with an instance (no need to remake) |

---

in component how to set fixed bottom nav or header ?

Here is the **correct way to make a fixed header or fixed bottom nav INSIDE a component** in Figma.  
This is a common problem—Figma does *not* fix elements inside a component by default, but you **can** make them behave like fixed elements using "Constraints."

---

# ✅ **How to Set a Fixed Header or Fixed Bottom Nav Inside a Component**

## ✔️ Step-by-step (super clear)

### **1. Select the element you want to fix**  
Example:  
- your **Header**  
- your **Bottom Navigation bar**

### **2. Open the right sidebar → find “Constraints”**

You will see options like:

- Left / Right  
- Top / Bottom  
- Center  
- Scale  

### **3. For a *fixed header* set:**
```
Horizontal: Left & Right
Vertical: Top
```
This keeps the header locked to the top of the component when the component resizes.

### **4. For a *fixed bottom navigation* set:**
```
Horizontal: Left & Right
Vertical: Bottom
```
This keeps it stuck to the bottom.

### That's it — this is how you “fix” UI elements inside a component.

---

# ⚠️ IMPORTANT
### Figma can ONLY make objects “fixed during scrolling” on a *Frame*, NOT inside components.

So if you want the header or footer to stay fixed *while scrolling* in a prototype:

### **You must put the component INSIDE a frame**, then:
1. Select the header/footer inside the frame  
2. In the right sidebar, turn ON:  
   **“Fix position when scrolling”**

But the component itself cannot have that toggle.

---

# 🧩 Best Practice (Industry Standard)

### **Do this:**
1. Create a **Header Component**  
2. Create a **Bottom Nav Component**  
3. Place them inside a **Screen Frame**  
4. Turn ON “Fix position when scrolling” on the header/footer inside the frame  
5. All screens that use these components will behave correctly

---

# 🎯 Quick Summary
| Goal | Do This |
|------|---------|
| Keep header/footer aligned inside component | Use **Constraints** (Top / Bottom + Left & Right) |
| Fix header/footer during prototype scrolling | Place component in a **Frame**, then enable **Fix position when scrolling** |
| Make reusable layout | Create separate header/nav components |

---

how to uncomponent?

To **uncomponent** something in Figma, there are two different actions depending on what you want:

---

# ✅ **1. If you want to remove a component instance back to a normal frame**
Use **Detach Instance**

### **How to Detach Instance:**
1. Select the instance  
2. Right-click → **Detach instance**  
   OR use the top bar button  
   OR use the shortcut (if available)

After detaching:
- It becomes a normal frame  
- It’s no longer linked to the main component  
- It will **not update** when the main component changes

---

# ✅ **2. If you want to “unmake” a Main Component**
You can **Turn Component Back to Frame**

### **How to do it:**
1. Select the **Main Component** (the one with the purple outline)
2. Right-click → **“Remove component”**  
   (older Figma calls this **“Detach component”** or **“Restore to frame”**)

After removing:
- It becomes a normal frame  
- All instances become detached automatically  
- It is no longer stored in Assets

---

# ❗ Important Notes
- **Detach instance** only affects that instance.  
- **Remove component** destroys the component completely.  
- If you only want to edit the component, you do **not** need to uncomponent.  
- Once detached, instances will not receive updates from the main component.

---

# 🧩 Summary
| What you want | What to do |
|---------------|------------|
| Turn instance → normal frame | **Detach instance** |
| Delete the whole component | **Remove component** |
| Edit the component | **Go to main component** (no need to uncomponent) |

---

i dont see detach component / restore to frame ?

No worries — this is a **common confusion** in Figma.  
Here’s why you **don’t see “Detach Component” / “Restore to Frame”** and what to do instead.

---

# ✅ FIRST — Which one are you selecting?

Figma shows **different menus** depending on whether you clicked:

### **A. An INSTANCE**  
(Blue outline, right panel shows “Go to main component”)  
→ You should see **Detach instance**

### **B. The MAIN COMPONENT**  
(Purple outline, right panel shows “Component”)  
→ You should see **Remove component** (NOT detach)

### **C. A FRAME (not a component)**  
(Black outline, right panel shows “Frame”)  
→ You will NOT see detach anything.

---

# 💡 IMPORTANT  
Figma **no longer uses “Restore to Frame” wording.**  
Now the correct menu is:

### **For MAIN COMPONENT:**
- **Right-click → Remove component**

### **For INSTANCE:**
- **Right-click → Detach instance**

If you don’t see it, here’s exactly why.

---

# ❗ WHY YOU DON’T SEE “Detach Instance”  
Here are the only possible reasons:

### **1. You are selecting the MAIN component**
Main components **cannot be detached** — because they ARE the original.  
Check the outline color: **purple** = main component.

### **2. You are selecting a normal frame**
Normal frames are NOT components, so detach doesn’t appear.

### **3. You are selecting inside the instance, not the instance itself**
You must select the **outer wrapper**, not a button or layer inside.

To fix:  
Select the whole component instance in the Layers panel.

---

# 🔎 HOW TO CHECK WHAT YOU SELECTED
Look at the right sidebar:

### If you see:
✔️ **Component** → you selected the **main component**  
✔️ **Instance** → you selected an **instance**  
✔️ **Frame** → you selected **not a component**

---

# 🧭 FIX: Step-by-step to detach an instance

### 1. Select the component on the canvas  
BUT make sure you select the whole instance (blue outline).

### 2. Check the right sidebar  
If it says **Instance**, you’re correct.

### 3. Right-click → **Detach instance**  
If you still don’t see it:  
Try the top bar:  
There is a button called **Detach instance** next to the instance name.

---

# 🧭 FIX: Step-by-step to “un-component” a main component

### 1. Select the MAIN component (purple outline)  
### 2. Right-click → **Remove component**

This turns it back into a normal frame.

---

# 🚀 If you want, send a screenshot  
Just show me:
- The thing you clicked  
- The right sidebar  

I can immediately tell you whether it's a **main component**, **instance**, or **frame** and guide you to the correct option.

kenapa setiap ganti tampilan tidak muncul di figma

Ada **beberapa penyebab umum** kenapa *setiap ganti tampilan (UI/layout) tidak muncul di Figma*. Biasanya ini terjadi karena komponen, instance, atau halaman tidak tersambung dengan benar.

Berikut **penjelasan paling sering terjadi + cara mengatasinya**:

---

# ✅ **1. Kamu mengedit *Instance*, bukan *Main Component***
Ini penyebab **nomor 1**.

### Ciri-cirinya:
- Outline biru (instance), bukan ungu (main component).
- Perubahan hanya terjadi di objek itu saja, tidak muncul di tempat lain.

### Cara perbaiki:
1. Pilih instance → klik kanan → **Go to main component**  
2. Edit **Main Component** (outline ungu)  
3. Semua instance otomatis update

---

# ✅ **2. Instance kamu sudah “Detached”**
Kalau instance ter-*detach*, dia kehilangan koneksi ke main component.

### Cek:
Klik instance → di sidebar **tidak ada tulisan “Instance”** → artinya sudah detached.

### Solusi:
- Hapus instance itu  
- Masukkan instance baru dari **Assets panel**

---

# ✅ **3. Kamu mengedit *halaman berbeda* (Page 1, Page 2, dst.)**
Kadang user mengedit di Page A tapi lihat hasilnya di Page B.

### Solusi:
Pastikan:
- Komponen ada di page yang tepat
- Instance berada di page tempat kamu mengecek perubahan

---

# ✅ **4. Kamu mengedit *Variant* yang salah**
Jika komponen punya beberapa variant (misal: default, active, selected), kamu mungkin mengedit variant yang tidak digunakan.

### Solusi:
- Pilih instance  
- Lihat **Property / Variant** yang dipakai  
- Edit variant *yang sama* di main component

---

# ✅ **5. Library belum di-update (kalau pakai Team Library)**
Jika komponen berasal dari library:

### Solusi:
1. Setelah edit main component → klik **Publish**  
2. Di file lain → klik **Update available** untuk apply perubahan

---

# ✅ **6. Ada Override yang memblok perubahan**
Terkadang instance punya override (misal: teks, warna) sehingga perubahan tidak muncul.

### Solusi:
Pilih instance → klik **Reset all overrides**

---

# ❗ Tanya cepat untuk memastikan:
Biar aku bantu 100% tepat, jawab 3 pertanyaan ini:

1. Kamu edit **main component** atau **instance**?  
2. Komponen dari **Library** atau **file yang sama**?  
3. Yang tidak muncul itu **perubahan style**, **layout**, atau **isi teks**?

Kalau kamu mau, ambil screenshot bagian **right sidebar** saat pilih objeknya — aku bisa langsung tahu masalahnya.
bukan component tapi frame + autolayout

Oke, kalau **bukan component**, hanya **Frame + Auto Layout**, tapi “perubahan tampilan tidak muncul”, berarti masalahnya ada di **pengaturan Auto Layout, constraints, atau nesting frame**, *bukan* di komponen.

Ini **penyebab paling umum + cara memperbaikinya**:

---

# ✅ 1. **Kamu mengedit frame di luar Auto Layout**
Figma sering punya banyak nested frame — kadang kamu mengedit frame yang salah.

### Ciri-ciri:
- Kamu ubah padding/spacing di salah satu frame, tapi tidak terlihat berubah.

### Solusi:
1. Pilih frame → lihat panel kanan  
2. Pastikan kamu mengedit **Auto Layout parent** yang benar  
3. Buka panel **Layers** untuk lihat struktur (hierarchy)-nya  
4. Edit Auto Layout pada **parent frame**, bukan child

---

# ✅ 2. **Constraints salah (misal: Left only, bukan Left & Right)**
Kalau constraints gagal, elemen tidak akan ikut resizing atau perubahan layout.

### Contoh masalah:
- Header tidak melar saat frame diperbesar  
- Bottom nav tidak ikut ke bawah  
- Button tidak ikut padding

### Solusi:
1. Pilih element  
2. Di **Constraints**, atur:  
   - Horizontal: **Left & Right**  
   - Vertical: **Top** (header), **Bottom** (footer)

---

# ✅ 3. **Auto Layout direction salah (Horizontal / Vertical)**
Jika direction tidak sesuai, perubahan tidak terlihat.

### Contoh:
- Kamu ingin turun ke bawah, tapi Auto Layout-nya horizontal  
- Spacing tidak berubah karena direction salah

### Solusi:
1. Pilih frame  
2. Lihat panel Auto Layout  
3. Pastikan **direction** sesuai:  
   - Vertical = elemen ke bawah  
   - Horizontal = elemen ke samping

---

# ✅ 4. **Frame terlalu kecil atau “hug contents”**
Kadang frame tidak berubah karena ukurannya otomatis mengikuti konten saja.

### Solusi:
Coba ubah **Resizing**:
- `Hug contents` → ganti ke **Fixed** atau **Fill container**  
- Atau perbesar frame manual

---

# ✅ 5. **Ada override dari ukuran manual**
Jika kamu pernah resize manual, Auto Layout bisa “terkunci”.

### Solusi:
- Pilih item → klik **Reset size** di panel kanan

---

# ✅ 6. **Nested Auto Layout blocking changes**
Jika ada Auto Layout dalam Auto Layout, perubahan hanya terjadi di level tertentu.

### Solusi:
- Buka layer tree → cek level mana yang harus diubah  
- Pastikan kamu edit Auto Layout yang paling atas (parent utama)

---

# 🎯 Supaya aku bisa bantu lebih tepat:
Jawab 3 hal ini:

1. Kamu ubah **apa**? (padding? spacing? posisi? alignment?)  
2. Kamu pilih **frame mana**? (parent? child?)  
3. Frame kamu pakai **Hug / Fill / Fixed**?

Kalau bisa kirim **screenshot panel kanan (Auto Layout settings)**, aku bisa langsung tunjukkan letak masalahnya.
i create frame with autolayout and create to component now how to uncomponent ?

Got it — **you created a Frame with Auto Layout**, then you **turned it into a Component**, and now you want to **turn it back into a normal Frame**.

Here is the correct way:

---

# ✅ **How to UN-Component a Component (turn back into normal Frame)**

### **1. Select the MAIN Component**  
Make sure you select the **purple-outline** component (the original), not an instance.

### **2. Use this shortcut:**

### **Mac:** `⌥⌘K`  
### **Windows:** `Alt + Ctrl + K`

This shortcut **toggles component ON/OFF**, so it will remove the component status.

### After that:
✔️ It becomes a normal **Frame** again  
✔️ Auto Layout stays  
✔️ Everything inside remains the same  
✔️ It will NOT appear in Assets anymore  

---

# 🔄 If the shortcut didn't work:  
It means you selected *inside* the component, not the component itself.

### Try this:
1. Click the frame on canvas  
2. If outline is **purple**, you're on the main component  
3. Now press the shortcut again  

OR do it manually:

### **Right-click → Remove component**

*(If you don’t see this menu, you're not selecting the main component.)*

---

# ❗ If you want to un-component an **instance**, not the main
Use:

### Mac: `⌥⌘B`  
### Windows: `Alt + Ctrl + B`

= **Detach Instance**

---

If you want, send a screenshot of the object selected — I can tell you instantly whether it’s a **main component**, **instance**, or **normal frame**, and which method you should use.
for detacth main component how ?

To **detach a MAIN component** in Figma (turn it back into a normal frame), you must **REMOVE the component**, because **main components cannot be “detached”** — only **instances** can be detached.

Here’s how to do it correctly:

---

# ✅ **How to Detach / Remove a MAIN Component**
(Main Component = purple outline)

### **Method 1 — Shortcut (fastest)**
Select the **main component**, then press:

### **Mac:** `⌥⌘K`  
### **Windows:** `Alt + Ctrl + K`

This **removes the component** and turns it back into a normal **Frame**.

---

# ✅ **Method 2 — Right-click**
1. Select the **main component** (purple outline)  
2. Right-click  
3. Choose **Remove component**

Now it becomes a normal frame again.

---

# ❗ Why you don’t see “Detach instance”
Because:
- **Detach instance** is ONLY for *instances* (blue outline)  
- **Main components cannot be detached**, only **removed**

---

# 🧩 Quick Summary
| What you want | What to use |
|---------------|-------------|
| Detach instance | `⌥⌘B` / `Alt+Ctrl+B` |
| Remove MAIN component (your case) | `⌥⌘K` / `Alt+Ctrl+K` |
| Turn frame → component | Same shortcut (toggle) |

---

If you want, send a screenshot of your selection, and I’ll confirm whether you’re selecting the main component or an instance.
select brand or selected brand or other sentence

Pemilihannya tergantung **fungsi teksnya** (judul, instruksi, atau status). Berikut panduan singkat + opsi terbaik:

---

## ✅ **Select Brand**
➡️ **Paling umum & benar** untuk:
- Judul dropdown
- Label form
- Instruksi singkat (UI)

**Contoh:**
- *Select Brand*
- *Select a Brand*

---

## ❌ **Selected Brand**
➡️ Dipakai untuk **status**, bukan instruksi.

**Contoh yang benar:**
- *Selected Brand: Sushi Tei*
- *Your Selected Brand*

❌ Tidak cocok sebagai tombol atau instruksi awal.

---

## ⭐ **Alternatif Kalimat yang Lebih Natural**
Tergantung tone yang diinginkan:

### 🔹 Simple / UI-friendly
- **Choose Brand**
- **Choose a Brand**

### 🔹 Lebih jelas
- **Select Your Brand**
- **Choose Your Preferred Brand**

### 🔹 Formal / corporate
- **Brand Selection**
- **Please Select a Brand**

---

## 🎯 Rekomendasi Terbaik (UI)
- **Label / Title:**  
  👉 **Select Your Brand**
- **Setelah dipilih (status):**  
  👉 **Selected Brand: [Brand Name]**

Kalau kamu kasih tahu ini dipakai di **dropdown, button, atau heading**, aku bisa pilihkan versi paling pas.

DO YOU WANT TO CANCEL WAITING LIST?

other sentence or cek grammar

Kalimat **“DO YOU WANT TO CANCEL WAITING LIST?”** bisa dipahami, tapi **kurang natural secara grammar**.

Berikut versi yang **lebih benar dan natural**, plus beberapa alternatif sesuai tone:

---

## ✅ **Perbaikan Grammar (Recommended)**
**Do you want to cancel the waiting list?**

Atau jika maksudnya *waiting list milik user*:

**Do you want to cancel your waiting list?**

---

## ⭐ **Alternatif Kalimat yang Lebih Baik**

### 🔹 UI / Confirmation (paling umum)
- **Are you sure you want to cancel the waiting list?**
- **Are you sure you want to leave the waiting list?**

### 🔹 Lebih spesifik & jelas
- **Do you want to cancel your spot on the waiting list?**
- **Would you like to cancel your waiting list request?**

### 🔹 Singkat (modal / popup)
- **Cancel waiting list?**
- **Leave waiting list?**

---

## 🎯 Rekomendasi Terbaik untuk Modal Konfirmasi
👉 **Are you sure you want to cancel your spot on the waiting list?**

Kalau mau, aku juga bisa bantu buatkan **button text** (Yes/No, Cancel/Keep Waiting, dsb.) supaya konsisten dan jelas.

Kalau kamu mau disesuaikan dengan **brand tone tertentu** (luxury, casual, family-friendly, Gen Z, dsb.), bilang saja—aku bisa refine lagi.
Bagaimana cara memperluas dan memajukan bisnis PT kurnia jaya las, karena memang baru banget mulai tolong beritahu aku semua trik nya

Siap. Karena **PT Kurnia Jaya Las masih sangat baru**, kita fokus ke **fondasi yang kuat + strategi cepat dapat proyek**, bukan teori yang ribet. Aku akan jelaskan **lengkap, praktis, dan bertahap**, seolah-olah kamu mau membesarkan bengkel las sampai jadi kontraktor las & fabrikasi besar.

---

## 1️⃣ Pastikan Fondasi Bisnis Kuat (WAJIB di Awal)

### A. Tentukan Posisi Bisnis (Ini Penting Banget)
Jawab dulu ini (walau di kepala):
- Fokus **las apa?**
  - Las pagar & kanopi rumah
  - Konstruksi baja ringan
  - Tangki, pipa, railing, truss
  - Proyek pabrik / industri
- Target klien:
  - Rumah tangga
  - Kontraktor
  - Developer
  - Pabrik

👉 **Saran awal**:  
Mulai dari **proyek kecil-menengah** (pagar, kanopi, railing) → cepat dapat cash → naik ke proyek besar.

---

### B. Legalitas = Senjata Kepercayaan
Kalau mau cepat berkembang:
- NIB & OSS ✔️
- NPWP badan ✔️
- Rekening atas nama PT ✔️
- Stempel + kop surat ✔️

📌 Banyak klien **tidak peduli murah**, tapi peduli **resmi & bisa dipercaya**.

---

## 2️⃣ Cara DAPAT PROYEK (Ini Kunci Hidup Mati)

### A. Kuasai 3 Jalur Proyek Utama

#### 🔥 1. Proyek Perorangan (Cepat Cair)
- Pagar
- Kanopi
- Railing
- Tangga

**Trik:**
- Foto hasil kerja → upload
- Minta testimoni
- Minta rekomendasi tetangga

---

#### 🔥 2. Kontraktor & Tukang Bangunan
Ini **emas**.

**Cara masuk:**
- Datangi proyek bangunan
- Kenalan mandor
- Bilang:  
  _“Kalau butuh las, saya siap bantu cepat dan rapi.”_

👉 Satu mandor = bisa 10 proyek.

---

#### 🔥 3. Online (WAJIB walau kecil)
Minimal:
- Google Maps (PT Kurnia Jaya Las)
- WhatsApp Business
- Instagram / Facebook

**Isi konten sederhana:**
- Before – after
- Video proses las
- Testimoni klien

📌 Banyak bengkel las hidup dari Google Maps doang.

---

## 3️⃣ TRIK HARGA BIAR MENANG TANPA RUGI

❌ Jangan banting harga sembarangan  
✅ Mainkan **nilai**

### Formula Harga Aman:
```
(Harga bahan + upah + transport + listrik) 
+ 20–40% margin
```

### Trik jitu:
- Beri 2 opsi:
  - Standar
  - Premium (bahan lebih tebal / finishing halus)

👉 Klien sering pilih **premium**.

---

## 4️⃣ Kualitas Kerja = PROMOSI GRATIS

Yang bikin bengkel las cepat besar:
- Sambungan rapi
- Ukuran presisi
- Datang tepat waktu
- Janji ditepati

💡 **Satu kesalahan = 10 orang batal order**  
💡 **Satu kerja bagus = 10 rekomendasi**

---

## 5️⃣ Bangun TIM walau Kecil

Awal cukup:
- 1 tukang las utama
- 1 helper

**Aturan emas:**
- Bayar tepat waktu
- Jangan pelit alat
- Ajari SOP (rapi, aman, bersih)

Tukang betah = bisnis stabil.

---

## 6️⃣ Upgrade Perlahan tapi PASTI

Prioritas alat:
1. Mesin las inverter bagus
2. Gerinda berkualitas
3. Mesin potong besi
4. APD (helm, sarung tangan)

📌 Jangan beli banyak, beli **yang kepakai terus**.

---

## 7️⃣ Trik Naik Kelas Jadi Proyek BESAR

Kalau sudah jalan 3–6 bulan:

- Buat **company profile sederhana (PDF)**
- Kumpulkan foto proyek
- Kerja sama:
  - Kontraktor
  - Arsitek
  - Supplier besi

👉 Dari sini bisa masuk:
- Pabrik
- Gudang
- Proyek pemerintah kecil

---

## 8️⃣ Kesalahan Fatal yang Harus DIHINDARI

❌ Terima proyek tanpa DP  
❌ Tidak ada perjanjian tertulis  
❌ Campur uang pribadi & bisnis  
❌ Janji berlebihan  
❌ Mengabaikan keselamatan kerja  

---

## 9️⃣ Pola Mental Pengusaha Las yang Sukses
- Sabar 6–12 bulan pertama
- Fokus reputasi, bukan untung besar dulu
- Bangun relasi, bukan cuma kerja

---

## 10️⃣ Kalau Kamu Mau, Aku Bisa Bantu LEBIH SPESIFIK
Bilang ke aku:
1. Lokasi kota/kabupaten
2. Fokus jasa las apa sekarang
3. Sudah punya alat apa saja
4. Tim berapa orang
5. Target: proyek rumah atau industri?

Aku bisa bikinin:
- Strategi cari proyek **khusus daerahmu**
- Contoh harga
- SOP kerja tukang las
- Script chat ke calon klien
- Rencana 3 bulan biar cepat jalan

Tinggal bilang 👍

parts:
Berikut **penjelasan lengkap tentang pendirian *Perseroan Perorangan*** di Indonesia — yang merupakan bentuk **badan hukum PT tapi dimiliki oleh satu orang saja** (cocok buat usaha kecil/UMKM seperti bengkel las atau usaha jasa lainnya). citeturn0search0turn0search10turn0search9

---

## 📌 Apa Itu *Perseroan Perorangan*?

**Perseroan Perorangan** adalah **bentuk PT yang didirikan hanya oleh satu orang** (pemilik tunggal), dan memiliki badan hukum resmi seperti PT biasa. Ini baru ada setelah perubahan aturan (UU Cipta Kerja & PP turunan). Dibandingkan PT biasa:

✔️ Hanya perlu **1 pemegang saham**  
✔️ Tidak perlu **notaris**  
✔️ Modal bebas (tidak ada minimal Rp50 juta seperti PT biasa)  
✔️ Proses pendaftaran **online elektronik**  
✔️ Memiliki status **badan hukum**  
✔️ Bisa buka **rekening bank atas nama badan hukum**  
✔️ Lebih dipercaya oleh klien/mitra dibanding usaha tanpa badan hukum citeturn0search10turn0search22

---

## 📝 Syarat Utama Pendirian Perseroan Perorangan

Untuk mendirikan, kamu harus memenuhi syarat berikut:

1. ⭐ **Warga negara Indonesia (WNI)**  
2. 📅 **Usia minimal 17 tahun**  
3. 🧠 **Cakap hukum** (tidak terganggu kemampuan hukumnya)  
4. 👤 **Hanya satu orang pendiri dan pemegang saham**  
5. 📊 Usaha termasuk **Usaha Mikro & Kecil (UMK)**  
   - Omzet maksimal sekitar Rp5 miliar/tahun  
   - Modal tidak lebih dari Rp5 miliar (tidak termasuk tanah & bangunan)  
6. 📄 Hanya boleh mendirikan **1 kali dalam 1 tahun**  
7. 🚫 Tidak boleh didirikan oleh *badan hukum* atau orang asing; harus perorangan⁣citeturn0search23turn0search29

---

## 📋 Dokumen yang Dibutuhkan

Persiapan dokumen standar antara lain:

✔️ **KTP asli** pendiri  
✔️ **NPWP pribadi**  
✔️ **Alamat usaha / lokasi PT perorangan**  
✔️ **Surat Pernyataan Pendirian** yang memuat:
- Nama dan tempat kedudukan perusahaan  
- Maksud & tujuan kegiatan usaha  
- Modal dasar, modal ditempatkan dan disetor  
- Nilai saham yang dimiliki  
- Nama lengkap pendiri, alamat, NIK & NPWP⁣citeturn0search0turn0search37

---

## 🚀 Langkah-Langkah Pendirian

1. **Siapkan dokumen** (KTP, NPWP, alamat usaha, dan surat pernyataan pendirian).  
2. **Buat akun di sistem AHU Online** (Kemenkumham).  
   Kamu mengisi data melalui aplikasi **Pendaftaran Perseroan Perorangan** di AHU Online. citeturn0search1  
3. Isi semua **form pendaftaran elektronik** dan unggah dokumen.  
4. **Submit & bayar PNBP (biaya admin)** — biasanya sangat murah (contoh Rp 50 ribu). citeturn0search40  
5. Sistem akan memproses dan mengeluarkan **sertifikat pendaftaran elektronik**.  
6. Setelah jadi, kamu bisa:
   - Mengurus **NPWP badan / NIB** di OSS
   - Buka **rekening bank atas nama PT perorangan**  
   - Ajukan izin usaha / SIUP jika diperlukan citeturn0search14

---

## ⚖️ Keuntungan *Perseroan Perorangan*

✅ Mendapatkan **badan hukum resmi**  
✅ Memisahkan kekayaan bisnis dan pribadi secara formal  
✅ Lebih mudah dapat klien **proyek besar**, tender, kontraktor  
✅ Bisa buka rekening atas nama perusahaan  
✅ Dapat kredit/pembiayaan usaha bank lebih mudah citeturn0search22

---

## ⚠️ Kekurangan / Hal yang Perlu Kamu Ketahui

❗ Karena hanya kamu pemilik, segala tanggung jawab akan menjadi tanggung jawab itu sendiri (walau kekayaan pribadi sudah lebih terlindungi dibanding usaha dagang biasa).  
❗ Tidak bisa punya lebih dari satu *Perseroan Perorangan* dalam setahun. citeturn0search29

---

## 🧠 Tips Praktis (Agar Usahamu Berjalan Lancar)

📍 **Nama perusahaan harus unik** dan belum terdaftar  
📍 Pastikan **KBLI usaha** (kode kegiatan ekonomi) sesuai dengan layanan kamu  
📍 Siapkan **pelaporan keuangan sederhana** karena tetap wajib laporan  
📍 Jika bingung atau mau cepat, kamu bisa gunakan **jasa legal online profesional**

---

Kalau kamu mau, aku bisa bantu **contoh format surat pernyataan pendirian**, **template dokumen**, atau panduan **langkah-langkah pendaftaran online lengkap**. Cukup bilang ya!

thoughts.summary: Proposing Flutter/Riverpod navigation and architecture
thoughts.content: For this, I need clear architecture: use a `StateProvider<Brand>` to track the selected brand, and conditionally render the dashboard based on that. When the user changes brands, update the `brandProvider` and rebuild the UI. I recommend using `Navigator` or `go_router`. Here's a possible flow: define the `Brand` enum, update `brandProvider` on drawer tap, and use a `Consumer` widget to watch the provider and adjust the UI accordingly.

parts: The bottomnavigation no need brand just if bran from drawer change the dashboard home change

thoughts.summary: Providing solution to adjust brand-specific navigation
thoughts.content: To implement this, keep one `Scaffold` and use a `selectedBrandProvider`. The `Home` widget listens for changes to this provider and updates the UI accordingly. For the bottom navigation, you don't need to involve the brand at all. Other tabs remain unaffected by brand changes.

parts: Dibuat full codw
Tambahkan tiap dashboard brand ada initial hit api

thoughts.summary: Adapting brand-specific API calls with Riverpod
thoughts.content: The user wants to add an "initial hit API" for each brand's dashboard, using Riverpod's FutureProvider.family. Each brand may call its own API endpoint the first time it's selected. We can adapt `homeDataProvider` to handle different URLs per brand, using the `http` package and placeholders for unknown URLs. Once a brand is selected, it can trigger the API, and `ref.invalidate` can be used when switching brands.

thoughts.summary: Implementing brand-specific initial API calls
thoughts.content: We can simplify things in `BrandHomePage` by using `ref.watch(homeDataProvider(brand));` to trigger the brand-specific API on the first load. For each brand, we can show the initial API call using `http.get(...)` and parse the JSON response, adding necessary fields. To keep data, use `ref.keepAlive()`. For refresh, an ElevatedButton could refresh with `ref.invalidate()`, with comments in Bahasa explaining that it triggers the API on first open and can be manually reloaded.

thoughts.summary: Menambahkan API awal untuk setiap dashboard brand
thoughts.content: User meminta API hit pada setiap dashboard brand. Kita bisa sesuaikan provider menggunakan `FutureProvider.family<String, Brand>`. API akan mengambil data dari URL yang disesuaikan per brand. Kita menggunakan `http` untuk mengambil respons, lalu parsing JSON, dan mengembalikan pesan. Jangan lupa untuk memasukkan `http` di `pubspec.yaml`.

thoughts.content:
The code stays mostly the same; I'll just update the dependency to `flutter_riverpod: ^3.0.3`. I'll show the pubspec snippet and clarify that imports can be adjusted if needed but we’ll keep the http package since the user wants the API.

Also, the homeDataProvider(brand) call is still valid as the Riverpod 3 semantics haven’t changed.

i have drawer with data brands how to selected with change and reload all dashboard brand

It sounds like you have a **dropdown (drawer) of brands**, and when a **brand is selected**, you want to:

1. **Detect the change event**
2. **Reload the dashboard data** based on the latest selected brand

Since you didn’t mention your tech stack (Angular, React, Vue, Blazor etc.), here are common working examples. Tell me your framework and I’ll tailor it perfectly to your code. 👇

---

## ✅ Generic Approach

### Step 1 — Store selected brand
When user selects the brand from dropdown, store the selected value:

```js
onBrandChange(selectedBrand) {
    this.currentBrand = selectedBrand;
    this.reloadDashboard();
}
```

---

### Step 2 — Reload dashboard data (API call)
```js
reloadDashboard() {
    this.api.getDashboardData(this.currentBrand).subscribe(data => {
        this.dashboardData = data;
    });
}
```

---

## Example UI Dropdown Events

### ⭐ Angular
```html
<select (change)="onBrandChange($event.target.value)">
  <option *ngFor="let brand of brands" [value]="brand.id">
    {{ brand.name }}
  </option>
</select>
```

---

### ⭐ React
```jsx
<select onChange={(e) => onBrandChange(e.target.value)}>
  {brands.map(b => (
    <option key={b.id} value={b.id}>{b.name}</option>
  ))}
</select>
```

---

### ⭐ Vue
```html
<select v-model="currentBrand" @change="reloadDashboard">
  <option v-for="b in brands" :value="b.id">{{ b.name }}</option>
</select>
```

---

## Optional — Auto-save selected brand
You can store selected brand in LocalStorage so page refresh keeps the filter:

```js
localStorage.setItem('brand', this.currentBrand);
```

On load:

```js
this.currentBrand = localStorage.getItem('brand');
```

parts:
That message is normal on Windows — Flutter needs **Developer Mode** enabled so it can create symlinks for plugin files when building with platform plugins. Quick fixes and steps you can follow now.

# Quick GUI way (recommended)
1. Press `Win + R`, paste:
   ```
   start ms-settings:developers
   ```
   and press Enter.  
2. In **Settings → Privacy & security → For developers** (or **Update & Security → For developers** on some Windows versions), toggle **Developer Mode** ON.  
3. Restart your terminal (close & reopen) and re-run:
   ```
   flutter pub get
   // or the command you ran:
   flutter pub add connectivity_plus
   ```
4. Run `flutter doctor -v` to confirm everything is OK.

# Command-line way (Admin) — one-liner
Open PowerShell **as Administrator** and run:
```powershell
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\AppModelUnlock" /t REG_DWORD /f /v "AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense" /d 1
```
Then restart your terminal and re-run `flutter pub get` / `flutter pub add ...`.

# Why this is required
- On Windows, Flutter uses symlinks for plugin folders during build. Creating symlinks requires Developer Mode (or Administrator privileges). Without it Flutter cannot wire platform plugin files and shows that message.

# If you can’t enable Developer Mode
- Run your terminal **as Administrator** before running `flutter pub add` — Admin can create symlinks, but enabling Developer Mode is the better long-term fix.
- Or develop inside WSL2 (Linux) where symlink behavior is not blocked — but that requires extra setup.

# Extra troubleshooting
- After enabling Developer Mode, if you still see plugin issues:
  1. `flutter clean`
  2. `flutter pub get`
  3. `flutter run -d windows` (or `flutter build windows`)
  4. Check `flutter doctor -v` for warnings.

If you want, I can give you a PowerShell script that:
- enables Developer Mode via registry,
- restarts your terminal session (or advises a restart),
- runs `flutter pub get`,
— tell me if you want the script and whether you can run PowerShell as Administrator.

Berikut beberapa pilihan terjemahan sesuai konteks antarmuka (UI):

- **“Nearest option appears selected”**
- **“Closest option is auto-selected”**
- **“The nearest choice is shown as selected”**
- **“Automatically select the nearest option”** (jika sebagai instruksi)

Kalau kamu punya konteks kalimat lengkap, aku bisa berikan terjemahan yang paling tepat.
terjemahan

Terjemahan yang paling sederhana dan umum untuk **“pilihan terdekat tampil ter-select”** dalam konteks UI adalah:

👉 **“The nearest option appears selected.”**

Jika konteksnya adalah fitur otomatis, bisa juga:

👉 **“Automatically select the nearest option.”**

Kalau butuh dalam bentuk lain (misalnya deskripsi fitur, tooltip, atau button text), beritahu ya!
DETAIL FORM FEEDBACK OR DETAIL FEEDBACK FORM ?

**Yang benar dan lebih alami dalam bahasa Inggris adalah:**

👉 **Detail Feedback Form**

Urutannya: **Jenis/tujuan form** + **kata “form”**

Contoh-contoh yang benar:
- **Registration Form**
- **Contact Form**
- **Feedback Form**
- **Detailed Feedback Form** (jika ingin menekankan bahwa feedback bersifat rinci)

Sementara **Detail Form Feedback** tidak natural dalam bahasa Inggris.

Jika kamu ingin menekankan halaman detail dari sebuah feedback, maka bentuknya berubah:
👉 **Feedback Detail(s)** atau **Feedback Details Page**

free for documentation diagram e.g in bottomnavigation have home with list location outlet, banner, hot deals, gift card, best seller, and delightfull choice

Got it! You want a **free documentation/navigation diagram** for a Bottom Navigation system that includes **Home**, and within Home you have:

- List Location Outlet  
- Banner  
- Hot Deals  
- Gift Card  
- Best Seller  
- Delightful Choice  

Here are **three** options you can use depending on your documentation style:

---

### 📌 Option 1 — Hierarchy Tree Diagram (Text-based)

```
Bottom Navigation
│
├── Home
│   ├── List Location Outlet
│   ├── Banner
│   ├── Hot Deals
│   ├── Gift Card
│   ├── Best Seller
│   └── Delightful Choice
│
├── [Other Tab 1]
├── [Other Tab 2]
└── [Other Tab 3]
```

---

### 📌 Option 2 — UML-Style Navigation Structure

```
+----------------------+
| Bottom Navigation UI |
+----------+-----------+
           |
     +-----+-----+
     |   Home   |
     +-----+-----+
           |
   +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+
   | Outlet List | Banner | Hot Deals | Gift Card |
   +-------------+--------+----------+-----------+
           | Best Seller | Delightful Choice |
           +-------------+------------------+
```

---

### 📌 Option 3 — Mermaid Diagram (for Markdown / Confluence)

```mermaid
graph TD
A[Bottom Navigation] --> B[Home]
B --> C[List Location Outlet]
B --> D[Banner]
B --> E[Hot Deals]
B --> F[Gift Card]
B --> G[Best Seller]
B --> H[Delightful Choice]
```

---

If you'd like, I can also:

✅ Add remaining bottom navigation items  
🎨 Provide a UI wireframe visual  
📱 Provide Android/iOS navigation documentation format  
📊 Include feature descriptions in table format

parts:
Good question 👍 — there *are* several **free online tools** you can use to draw a navigation diagram (or any kind of flowchart / UI-flow / sitemap / diagram) for the web/app. Here are some I recommend:

| Tool | What it’s good for / Pros |
|------|---------------------------|
| **entity["software","diagrams.net",0]** (formerly entity["software","draw.io",0]) | Free, web-based, no login required; simple drag-and-drop interface; supports flowcharts / UI diagrams / process diagrams — good for your “Bottom Navigation → Home → sub-pages” diagram. citeturn0search38turn0search13turn0search17 |
| **entity["software","Lucidchart",0]** | Offers more polished UI, many templates, good for flowcharts / site maps / navigation diagrams; good if you want more professional look or collaboration. citeturn0search21turn0search25turn0search39 |
| **entity["software","Visual Paradigm Online",0]** (free tier) | Web-based flowchart/diagram/ER-diagram tool; useful if you want drag-and-drop diagrams and nice export options. citeturn0search32turn0search30 |
| **entity["software","Miro",0]** / other white-board tools | Useful if you also want brainstorming + diagramming + collaboration; often good for UI flows when you want flexible canvas. citeturn0search25turn0search14 |

---

If you like — I can **generate a ready-to-use “template file” (in e.g. diagrams.net / Lucidchart)** for your bottom-navigation + home → sub-page diagram (as we sketched earlier). You just copy/paste / import it into the tool and edit if needed.  
Do you want me to build that template for you now (as Markdown + mermaid / or diagrams.net compatible)?

parts: what best design for that, give me recommendation

Great — here’s a clear recommendation based on **mobile UX best practices** and **e-commerce structure** like Shopee / Tokopedia / Amazon apps.

---

## ✅ Recommended Navigation Design

### **Bottom Navigation (5 items)**  
Keep only the *most-used, daily-engagement* features here:

1️⃣ **Home**  
2️⃣ **Search / Explore**  
3️⃣ **Cart**  
4️⃣ **Wishlist / Favorites**  
5️⃣ **Profile / Account**

> Home should remain simple — a *content hub*, not a navigation jungle.

---

## 📌 Home — Recommended Content Layout

Organize your Home page in **sections** (scrollable vertically):

| Section | UX Purpose |
|--------|------------|
| **Banner** | Main promo visibility (rotating carousel) |
| **Quick Actions** (grid icons) | Fast access to gift card, outlets, membership, etc. |
| **Hot Deals** | Flash/discount items = conversion driver |
| **Best Seller** | Social proof to boost trust & sales |
| **Delightful Choice** | Personalized recommendations |
| **Outlet Finder** (location list) | If relevant for your product category |

---

### 💡 Suggested Home Page Order (Best CTR)

```
Banner (Top — Hero Promo)
↓
Quick Actions Grid
↓
Hot Deals
↓
Best Seller
↓
Delightful Choice
↓
Location Outlet List (Optional if physical store)
```

---

## 🎨 Component Breakdown (clean & scalable)

```
Home Page
│
├── Header (Location + Search Input)
├── Banner Carousel
├── Quick Actions Menu (icon grid)
├── Flash Sale / Hot Deals slider
├── Best Seller grid
├── Personalized Section (Delightful Choice)
└── Store Finder section (collapsible)
```

---

## 🧠 UX Guidelines

| Principle | Application |
|----------|-------------|
| Show deals early | Users scroll most at top |
| Keep outlet list minimal | Expand or modal popup |
| Avoid too many navigation choices inside Home | Prevent cognitive overload |
| Personalize content | Location-based recommendation |

---

## 🏆 Why this design is best  
✔ Industry-standard layout (Shopee / Lazada / Tokopedia UX patterns)  
✔ Increases **engagement**, **conversion**, **scroll depth**, **retention**  
✔ Scales as features grow (just reorder sections)  
✔ Keeps Bottom Navigation clean + meaningful  

---

If you'd like, I can also provide:

📌 A visual wireframe (Figma-style preview)  
📌 A ready-to-import diagram for design documentation  
📌 UI component specification and notes  
📌 User flow & navigation mapping for developers  

➡ Would you like me to create a **Figma export-ready wireframe** next?
closest option dalam bahasa lain

Oke! **“Closest option dalam bahasa lain”** aku pahami sebagai:

👉 Kamu ingin **rekomendasi desain yang paling mendekati (closest option)** tapi disajikan **dalam bahasa lain**, khususnya **Bahasa Indonesia**.

Jadi berikut adalah versi rekomendasi terbaik untuk struktur navigasi tadi **dalam Bahasa Indonesia**:

---

## ⭐ Rekomendasi Desain Navigasi (Versi Terbaik)

### **Bottom Navigation — 5 Menu Utama**
(Paling sering digunakan oleh pengguna)

1️⃣ **Beranda**  
2️⃣ **Cari / Jelajahi**  
3️⃣ **Keranjang**  
4️⃣ **Favorit / Wishlist**  
5️⃣ **Akun / Profil**

> Tujuannya: cepat, mudah dipahami, daya tarik harian tinggi.

---

## 🏠 Struktur Konten Halaman Beranda

| Bagian | Tujuan Utama |
|--------|---------------|
| **Banner Promo** | Menampilkan promo utama (carousel) |
| **Menu Akses Cepat** | Ikon-ikon penting: Gift Card, Outlet, dsb. |
| **Hot Deals / Flash Sale** | Pemicu konversi tertinggi |
| **Best Seller** | Produk terlaris → bukti sosial |
| **Rekomendasi Untukmu (Delightful Choice)** | Personalisasi sesuai kebiasaan |
| **Lokasi Outlet** *(opsional)* | Jika bisnis punya toko fisik |

---

### 📌 Urutan Konten Beranda yang Disarankan

```
Header (Lokasi + Pencarian)
↓
Banner Promo Utama
↓
Menu Akses Cepat (Grid)
↓
Hot Deals / Flash Sale
↓
Best Seller
↓
Rekomendasi Untukmu
↓
Lokasi Outlet (Collapsible)
```

---

## 🎯 Kenapa ini adalah opsi terdekat & terbaik?
✔ Sesuai pola UX e-commerce populer (Shopee, Tokopedia, Lazada)  
✔ Mendorong **penjualan** & **kedalaman scroll**  
✔ Tidak membingungkan pengguna baru  
✔ Mudah dikembangkan fitur baru ke depan  

---

## Jika kamu butuh versi bahasa lain:
Saya bisa buatkan juga dalam:  
🌏 English | 🇲🇾 Melayu | 🇻🇳 Vietnam | 🇯🇵 Jepang | 🇰🇷 Korea | dll.

---

### Ingin lanjut ke tahap apa?
Pilih satu:

A. 🎨 Buat **UI Wireframe** ala Figma  
B. 📊 Buat **Diagram Dokumentasi** untuk tim (Mermaid / UML / Draw.io)  
C. 🧩 Buat **User Flow & Komponen Dev**  
D. Semua di atas (paket lengkap)

Kamu pilih yang mana? 😄
closest option dalam bahasa lain yg lebih menarik

Siap! Aku akan buat **versi yang lebih menarik & lebih “marketing-friendly”** dalam **Bahasa Indonesia yang lebih hidup**, seperti kamu sedang menyajikan konsep desain ke klien atau stakeholder 😄

---

## 🌟 Rekomendasi Desain Navigasi — **Pilihan Paling Tepat & Mendekati Tren Global**

### 🚀 Bottom Navigation — 5 Pilar Experience Pengguna
Dirancang untuk **akses tercepat** ke tujuan terpopuler pengguna:

1️⃣ **Beranda** — pusat semua penawaran terbaik  
2️⃣ **Jelajah** — temukan lebih banyak, makin penasaran  
3️⃣ **Keranjang** — belanja jadi lebih cepat dan pasti  
4️⃣ **Favoritku** — simpan wishlist, kembali kapan saja  
5️⃣ **Aku** — semua tentang profil & preferensi pengguna  

> *Sederhana, familiar, dan memaksimalkan engagement.*

---

## 🏠 Desain Konten Beranda — **Dimulai Dengan Hal yang Menghasilkan**

```
📍 Lokasi + Pencarian instan
🎯 Banner Promo Utama — “langsung menarik mata”
⚡ Hot Deals — “tawaran yang gak boleh kelewatan”
🔥 Best Seller — “yang lagi ngehits”
💛 Rekomendasi Untukmu — personal & relevan
📍 Outlet Terdekat — hanya jika dibutuhkan
```

✔ *Urutan ini terbukti meningkatkan CTR & lama waktu di layar*

---

## 💡 Filosofi UX di Baliknya

| Prinsip | Kenapa Penting |
|--------|----------------|
| **One-Thumb Friendly** | Semua mudah dijangkau dengan satu tangan |
| **Hero Content First** | Promo yang tepat meningkatkan penjualan sejak detik pertama |
| **Personalisasi** | Membuat pengguna merasa dimengerti |
| **Minim Overthinking** | Navigasi jelas → keputusan lebih cepat |

---

## 🎁 “Closest Option” + Sedikit Sentuhan WOW

✨ Kamu tetap mempertahankan menu yang kamu sebut:  
- Outlet  
- Banner  
- Hot Deals  
- Gift Card  
- Best Seller  
- Delightful Choice  

💎 Tetapi ditata ulang menjadi **alur visual yang mengundang klik**, bukan daftar yang membingungkan.

Hasilnya: **Desain yang terasa premium & relevan** — tapi tetap sangat familiar bagi user retail/e-commerce.

---

## 🎨 Selling Point untuk Dokumentasi
> “Beranda ini bukan sekadar halaman awal —  
> tapi mesin utama untuk meningkatkan konversi.”

📌 Siap dipresentasikan untuk approval product owner / management.

---

Kalau kamu mau, aku bisa bantu buat versi visualnya juga:

A. Figma Wireframe ✨  
B. Draw.io / Lucidchart diagram 📊  
C. Versi Bahasa Inggris untuk dokumen resmi 🌍  
D. Pitch Deck 1 slide untuk presentasi internal 🎤  

Mau aku buatin yang mana dulu? 😄
pilihan terdekat dalam bahasa inggris

Got it! Here is the **closest option** — same recommended structure as before, but now in **polished and engaging English**:

---

## 🌟 Recommended Navigation Design — **Closest UX Standard Option**

### 🚀 Bottom Navigation — 5 Core Experience Touchpoints

1️⃣ **Home** — the central hub of discovery  
2️⃣ **Explore** — browse, search, and get inspired  
3️⃣ **Cart** — quick access to checkout  
4️⃣ **Favorites** — your wishlist all in one place  
5️⃣ **Account** — personalization & user settings  

> Simple. Familiar. Highly optimized for daily engagement.

---

## 🏠 Home Screen Content — Designed to Drive Conversions

```
📍 Location + Smart Search Bar
🎯 Hero Banner — high-impact promotion
⚡ Hot Deals / Flash Sale — urgency & excitement
🔥 Best Sellers — social proof that boosts trust
💛 Recommended For You — personalized picks
📍 Store Locator — optional, collapsible
```

✔ This order maximizes **scroll depth**, **click-through rate**, and **shopping intent**.

---

## 🧠 UX Principles Behind It

| Principle | Benefit |
|----------|---------|
| **One-hand reachability** | Easy use while moving or multitasking |
| **Content hierarchy** | Most valuable content always comes first |
| **Personal relevance** | Users stay longer, browse more |
| **Low cognitive load** | Users don’t have to think — they just act |

---

## 🎁 Closest Match to Your Original Idea
Your original items are **preserved** and made more **user-friendly**:

| Your Item | Improved Placement |
|----------|-------------------|
| Banner | Hero Banner at the top |
| Hot Deals | Flash Sale section |
| Best Seller | Highlighted product grid |
| Delightful Choice | Personalized recommendation section |
| List Location Outlet | Store Finder at bottom |
| Gift Card | Included in Quick-Access menu |

✨ Same features  
💡 Better flow  
🚀 Higher conversion potential  

---

## 🎨 Documentation-Ready Positioning
> “The Home screen functions as a content engine that delivers personalized value from the moment the user arrives.”

Professional, modern, and globally recognizable.

---

If you want, I can now deliver one of these formats:

A. Visual Wireframe (Figma-style)  
B. Navigation Diagram (draw.io / Lucidchart / Mermaid)  
C. Product Documentation Page (English ready for developers)  
D. Presentation Slide for stakeholders  

Which one would you like next? 😄
Buatkan skema wireframe flowchartnya

Siap! Aku buatkan **dua bagian** supaya jelas:

1️⃣ **Flowchart Alur Navigasi Dashboard Multi-Brand**  
2️⃣ **Skema Wireframe Layout Dashboard**

Jika kamu ingin, ini semua bisa dimasukkan ke dokumentasi resmi project.

---

## **1️⃣ Flowchart — Brand → Dashboard → Menu**
Format **Mermaid** (bisa langsung dipakai di Notion / GitHub / Figma)

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Login Page] --> B{Authenticated?}
    B -- No --> A
    B -- Yes --> C[Brand Selector]

    C --> |Pick Brand| D[Load Brand Config]
    D --> E[Dashboard Page]

    E --> F{Menu Selection}

    F --> |Overview| G[Overview Section]
    F --> |Orders| H[Orders Section]
    F --> |Reservations| I[Reservations Section]
    F --> |Settings| J[Settings Page]

    G --> E
    H --> E
    I --> E
    J --> E
```

---

## **2️⃣ Struktur Arsitektur UI Flow (Multi-Brand Shared Dashboard)**

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    subgraph Core App
      M[main.dart] --> R[Router]
      R --> AuthFlow[/Auth Routes/]
      R --> BrandFlow[/Brand Routes/]
    end

    AuthFlow --> LoginPage
    BrandFlow --> BrandSelector

    subgraph Dashboard Shared
      BrandSelector --> BrandDashboardPage
      BrandDashboardPage --> DrawerMenu
      DrawerMenu --> Sections
    end

    subgraph Sections
      Overview
      Orders
      Reservations
      Settings
    end
```

---

## **3️⃣ Wireframe Visual – Brand Dashboard**

🧱 **Dashboard Layout (Generic)**

```
+---------------------------------------------------------+
| AppBar (Brand Name + Brand Primary Color)               |
+----------------------+----------------------------------+
| Drawer               |                                  |
| - Brand Logo         |          Content Area            |
| - Menu List          |                                  |
|   * Overview         |   - Dynamic based on menu        |
|   * Orders           |   - Brand color theme applied    |
|   * Reservations     |   - Widgets reusable             |
|   * Settings         |                                  |
|                      |                                  |
+----------------------+----------------------------------+
```

---

### Wireframe tiap bagian menu (contoh)

📌 **Overview Section**

```
+-----------------------------------------+
| KPI Cards (Revenue / Orders / etc)     |
+-----------------------------------------+
| Chart Area                              |
+-----------------------------------------+
| Latest Activities Table                 |
+-----------------------------------------+
```

📌 **Orders Section**

```
+-----------------------------------------+
| Filters (Date, Status, Outlet, etc)     |
+-----------------------------------------+
| Orders DataTable                        |
+-----------------------------------------+
```

📌 **Reservations Section**

```
+-----------------------------------------+
| Calendar / Upcoming Reservations        |
+-----------------------------------------+
| Quick Actions                           |
+-----------------------------------------+
```

---

## 4️⃣ Alur Data (High-Level)

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    User->>BrandRouter: Access /brand/:type/dashboard
    BrandRouter->>BrandService: Request Brand by Type
    BrandService-->>BrandRouter: Return Brand Model & Config
    BrandRouter->>DashboardPage: Build Dashboard with Brand
    DashboardPage->>Drawer: Send Brand Menu
    Drawer->>DashboardPage: User selects Section
    DashboardPage->>API: Fetch Section Data with brand.id
    API-->>DashboardPage: Brand specific response
```

---

## Kesimpulan

| Aspek | Status |
|-------|--------|
| 1 Dashboard untuk semua brand | **BISA** |
| Perbedaan UI dijalankan oleh Brand Config | **YES** |
| Routing brand-based | **YES** |
| Scalability untuk brand baru | **1 file config saja!** |

---

Kalau kamu mau, aku bisa lanjut:

✔ Buat **design guideline** (warna, typography, spacing)  
✔ Buat **komponen Flutter** yang sudah dynamic by brand  
✔ Buat **dokumen project architecture lengkap (PDF / Notion style)**  
✔ Implementasi routing & provider untuk manage active brand  

Mau aku export versi **gambar SVG / PDF** biar bisa ditempel ke Figma / presentasi?

Buatkan sitemap untuk aplikasi sushi tei superapps didalamnya terdapat multi brands ada 5 brand dan di dashboard itu header di isi  drawer menu, logo, search icon dan keranjang, lalu didalem konten ada nearby outlet terdekat, banner, hot deals produk, gift card banner, all product, and near you outlet.

thoughts.summary: Creating sitemap for sushi tei superapp in Indonesian
thoughts.content:
I’m organizing the sitemap for this sushi tei superapp with multiple brands.

At a high level, there’s the app root, authentication, and onboarding. Main navigation includes: Home, Explore/Brands, Orders, and Account. The **Home** page is structured with a header (including logo, search, and cart), while the main content features nearby outlets, banners, hot deals, products, and a gift card. I'll adopt a simple structured hierarchy for clarity.

parts:
Oke, kita bikin sitemap-nya dulu ya biar struktur superapps-nya rapi dan kebayang jelas. Aku tulis dalam bentuk hirarki (tree) + sedikit keterangan.

---

## 1. Struktur Utama Aplikasi (Top Level)

1. **Onboarding & Auth**
   - 1.1 Splash Screen  
   - 1.2 Onboarding (slide fitur-fitur utama)
   - 1.3 Login / Register
     - 1.3.1 Login (Email/Phone/SSO)
     - 1.3.2 Register
     - 1.3.3 Lupa Password

2. **Main App (Setelah Login)**
   - 2.1 **Dashboard / Home**
   - 2.2 **Brand Hub (Multi Brand – 5 brand)**
   - 2.3 **Order / Riwayat Pesanan**
   - 2.4 **Akun / Profile**
   - 2.5 **Notifikasi**

---

## 2. Dashboard / Home (Seperti yang kamu minta)

### 2.1 Header (sticky di atas)
- 2.1.1 **Drawer Menu (Hamburger Menu)**
  - 2.1.1.1 Profile
  - 2.1.1.2 Brand List (5 brand)
  - 2.1.1.3 Promo & Deals
  - 2.1.1.4 Gift Card
  - 2.1.1.5 Outlet Locator
  - 2.1.1.6 Bantuan / FAQ
  - 2.1.1.7 Pengaturan (Bahasa, Notifikasi, dll.)
  - 2.1.1.8 Tentang & Kebijakan
- 2.1.2 **Logo Superapps (Sushi Tei Superapps)**
- 2.1.3 **Search Icon**
  - 2.1.3.1 Search Page  
    - Search produk
    - Filter brand
    - Filter kategori
- 2.1.4 **Keranjang (Cart Icon)**
  - 2.1.4.1 Cart Page
    - List item
    - Ubah qty, hapus item
    - Info outlet pengambilan / delivery
    - Tombol Checkout

### 2.2 Konten Dashboard

Urutannya bisa seperti ini:

- 2.2.1 **Nearby Outlet Terdekat (Top Section)**
  - List outlet terdekat (card horizontal)
    - Nama outlet
    - Jarak
    - Status (Open/Closed)
    - CTA: “Pilih outlet”
  - 2.2.1.1 Outlet Detail
    - Alamat
    - Jam operasional
    - Map (embedded)
    - Fasilitas
    - Tombol “Order di outlet ini”

- 2.2.2 **Main Banner**
  - Slider banner promo utama (bisa multi brand)
  - Klik banner → ke halaman promo/detail campaign

- 2.2.3 **Hot Deals Produk**
  - Section khusus produk promo
    - Card produk (foto, nama, brand, harga coret & harga promo)
  - 2.2.3.1 Detail Produk (dari Hot Deals)
    - Foto produk
    - Nama produk
    - Brand
    - Harga normal & diskon
    - Deskripsi
    - Variasi (jika ada)
    - Tombol + ke keranjang

- 2.2.4 **Gift Card Banner**
  - Banner khusus Gift Card
  - Klik → 2.2.4.1 Halaman Gift Card
    - Pilih nominal
    - Pilih desain kartu
    - Kirim ke diri sendiri / orang lain
    - Metode pembayaran

- 2.2.5 **All Product**
  - Grid/list semua produk lintas brand (bisa dibatasi per brand dengan filter)
    - Filter:
      - Brand (5 brand)
      - Kategori (Sushi, Bento, Minuman, Dessert, dll.)
      - Harga, rating, dsb.
  - 2.2.5.1 Product Detail (umum, sama seperti di Hot Deals)
  - 2.2.5.2 Kategori Page
    - List produk per kategori (contoh: Sushi Roll, Nigiri, Bento)

- 2.2.6 **Near You Outlet (Section tambahan lebih ke eksplor outlet)**
  - List outlet dekat user (bisa berbeda dari “outlet pilihan untuk order”)
  - 2.2.6.1 Outlet Detail (sama seperti 2.2.1.1)
  - 2.2.6.2 Fitur “Lihat semua outlet”  
    - Map view + list view

---

## 3. Multi Brand (5 Brand di dalam Superapps)

Misalnya ada 5 brand: Brand A, Brand B, Brand C, Brand D, Brand E (nama bisa disesuaikan).  
Strukturnya:

3.1 **Brand Hub**
- 3.1.1 List Brand (5 brand)
  - Card brand (logo, deskripsi singkat)
- 3.1.2 Brand Detail (Landing brand)
  - 3.1.x.1 Brand Home
    - Banner promo khusus brand
    - Kategori produk brand tersebut
    - Produk recommended
  - 3.1.x.2 Menu / Kategori
    - List per kategori
  - 3.1.x.3 Promo Brand
  - 3.1.x.4 Outlet yang menyediakan brand tersebut  
    - Filter by lokasi

(*x* = 1–5 untuk tiap brand)

Struktur generik per brand:
- Brand [1–5]
  - Home Brand
  - Menu
  - Promo Brand
  - Outlet Brand
  - Detail Produk Brand

---

## 4. Checkout & Pesanan

4.1 **Cart / Keranjang** (juga akses dari icon di header)
- List item dari berbagai brand (kalau diijinkan campur)
- Info outlet & metode order (delivery / pickup)
- Voucher / Promo code
- Ringkasan pembayaran
- Tombol “Lanjut ke Pembayaran”

4.2 **Checkout**
- 4.2.1 Metode penerimaan
  - Delivery
  - Pick Up
- 4.2.2 Alamat (kalau delivery)
- 4.2.3 Metode pembayaran
  - E-wallet
  - Kartu kredit/debit
  - Bank transfer
  - Point balance (jika ada loyalty)
- 4.2.4 Review Order
- 4.2.5 Konfirmasi & Payment Success

4.3 **Order Tracking**
- 4.3.1 Status pesanan (Diterima, Diproses, Dikirim, Selesai)
- 4.3.2 Detail pesanan
- 4.3.3 Tombol bantuan (hubungi CS / outlet)

4.4 **Riwayat Pesanan**
- List pesanan sebelumnya
- Reorder

---

## 5. Gift Card & Promo

5.1 **Gift Card**
- 5.1.1 List Gift Card
- 5.1.2 Detail Gift Card
- 5.1.3 Riwayat Gift Card (yang dimiliki / digunakan)

5.2 **Promo & Hot Deals (Global)**
- 5.2.1 List Promo
- 5.2.2 Detail Promo
- 5.2.3 Syarat & Ketentuan

---

## 6. Profile & Pengaturan

6.1 **Profil Pengguna**
- Data pribadi
- Alamat tersimpan
- Metode pembayaran tersimpan
- Preference (bahasa, dll.)

6.2 **Loyalty / Membership**
- Poin
- Level member
- Reward

6.3 **Notifikasi**
- Promo
- Status Order
- Informasi sistem

6.4 **Pengaturan**
- Bahasa
- Notifikasi
- Privasi

6.5 **Bantuan & Info**
- FAQ
- Hubungi Kami
- Syarat & Ketentuan
- Kebijakan Privasi
- Tentang Aplikasi

---

Kalau kamu mau, habis ini aku bisa bantu bikin **wireframe simpel** untuk halaman Dashboard/Home berdasarkan sitemap di atas (misalnya layout header + urutan section konten) atau bikin **user flow** dari “buka app → pilih outlet → pilih produk → checkout”.
Buat kan sitemap dari gambar berikut

Berikut **Sitemap dari aplikasi berdasarkan screenshot** yang kamu berikan. Aku susun sesuai struktur navigasi yang terlihat: **Dashboard/Home**, **Drawer Menu**, **Bottom Navigation**, serta halaman terkait produk & outlet.

---

# 📍 **Sitemap Sushi Tei Superapps (berdasarkan UI screenshot)**

---

## 🏠 1. **Home / Dashboard**

### 🔹 Header
- Menu Drawer (≡)
- Logo Sushi Tei
- Search
- Cart

### 🔹 Konten Home
1. **Selected Outlet**
   - Outlet Selector & GPS chooser
   - Change Outlet Modal

2. **Membership Card**
   - Profile & QR member
   - Points & Expiry
   - Reload button

3. **Main Banner (Promo Slider)**

4. **Hot Deals Section**
   - Carousel produk promo
   - CTA: View All Hot Deals → (List product promo)

5. **Gift Card Banner**
   - CTA: Gift Card Page

6. **Best Seller Section**
   - Carousel produk terlaris

thoughts.summary: Menyempurnakan desain ListTiles
thoughts.content: Pengguna ingin meningkatkan desain ListTile untuk menyesuaikan dengan warna latar belakang 0xFF016332. parts:
Siap! Kita rapihkan tampilan **card kecil** tersebut:

✔ Border **putih** di luar  
✔ Isi card **semua putih** (icon + text)  
✔ Spasi lebih rapi  
✔ Rounded corner  
✔ Align baik (leading icon → text → trailing icon)

---

### ✨ Revised Card Code

Langsung ganti Container kamu dengan ini:

```dart
Container(
  decoration: BoxDecoration(
    borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(12),
    border: Border.all(color: Colors.white, width: 1.2),
  ),
  padding: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 12, vertical: 10),
  child: Row(
    children: [
      const Icon(Icons.dashboard, color: Colors.white, size: 20),
      const SizedBox(width: 10),
      
      Expanded(
        child: Text(
          "Lippo Mall Kemang - 0.8 km",
          style: const TextStyle(
            color: Colors.white,
            fontSize: 14,
            fontWeight: FontWeight.w500,
          ),
          overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis,
        ),
      ),

      const SizedBox(width: 10),
      const Icon(Icons.location_on, color: Colors.white, size: 20),
    ],
  ),
),
```

---

### 🧩 Optional Improvement (kalau kamu set background hijau brand kamu)

Jika container berada di atas background hijau (#016332), tampilannya akan auto **elegan premium** 🤌

Kamu bisa juga tambahkan sedikit margin jika banyak card:

```dart
margin: const EdgeInsets.only(bottom: 10),
```

---

### 🔥 Hasil UI
| Sebelum | Sesudah |
|--------|---------|
| Melekat tanpa spasi | Spasi + padding rapi |
| Tidak ada border | Border putih solid |
| Icon & Text warna default | Semua putih → kontras clean |

---

Kalau kamu mau, aku bisa:

✨ Animasi tap (ripple putih)  
✨ Icon location bisa diganti arah panah → navigasi  
✨ Tambah **subtitle**: open/close status  
✨ Badge status (misal: "Open") di kanan atas card  

Mau kita apply style ini **ke semua card “In Your Area”** otomatis? 😊
